channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title:
"Two months of darkness."
Evacuations are underway for people hiding beneath the Azovstal steel factory in Mariupol, Ukraine. One worker said that she had not seen sunlight in weeks. https://t.co/4FNMCBB91S https://t.co/N1wyvwBfTG
The fact that Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson chose to make their red carpet debut in Washington was a pretty clear indication of how they wanted to be seen by the world. https://t.co/03mrWFFrMX

Russia committed about 65% of its ground combat forces to the war in Ukraine, and more than a quarter of those are now likely “combat ineffective,” Britain said. The assessment added to intelligence reports that Russian forces have suffered heavy losses. https://t.co/J2TOBmDRLV

As the presidential election in the Philippines nears, many young voters support Leni Robredo, the vice president. She faces long odds against Ferdinand Marcos Jr., son of a late dictator, as some in an older generation are nostalgic for strongman rule. https://t.co/mR3BtaVp7M

House Speaker Nancy Pelosi traveled to Kyiv over the weekend, leading the second senior American delegation to meet with President Volodymyr Zelensky and declare support for Ukraine's fight against Russia. https://t.co/d2MxIjKfYF

Oleg Tinkov, one of Russia’s few self-made business tycoons, spoke out against his country’s war in Ukraine. Now he is in hiding.
In an exclusive interview he said, “I don’t believe in Russia’s future’’ under President Vladimir Putin. https://t.co/fT5ta26ddn

Régine, who was credited with opening the world's first disco, has died at 92. She built a $500 million empire of 23 clubs in Europe, the Middle East and the Americas, including Régine’s in Manhattan, the most famous nightspot of its era. https://t.co/FMFz5XwWRn https://t.co/w9aTgR0WGX

Besieged by multiplying scandals and salacious accusations, Representative Madison Cawthorn, Republican of North Carolina, is under mounting pressure from both parties to end his short career in Congress. https://t.co/vgFpf2glnT

Tucker Carlson has weaponized his viewers' fears to create what may be the most racist show in the history of cable news.
A New York Times examination shows how intertwined his rise has been with the transformation of Fox News and U.S. conservatism. https://t.co/176OLUd00R

Tucker Carlson is the champion of the most ardent Donald Trump followers. After 2016, his show focused on the emotional core of Trump’s allure: white panic over an increasingly diverse U.S.
The shift powered Carlson's rise — and reshaped Fox News. https://t.co/MPDVIOql1p https://t.co/2kA4Da8gvl

Ukrainian soprano Liudmyla Monastyrska sang the title role in “Turandot” at the Metropolitan Opera on Saturday, replacing a Russian diva who was dropped over past support of Vladimir Putin. At curtain calls, Monastyrska emerged wrapped in Ukraine's flag. https://t.co/QRSM8hZPUN https://t.co/rV8DaOlLHT

Nancy Pelosi made an unannounced visit to Ukraine’s capital Saturday, becoming the highest-ranking U.S. official to meet with President Volodymyr Zelensky since the war started. She told him, "Our commitment is to be there for you until the fight is done." https://t.co/qiefJPVPMt https://t.co/ms1jTh5Fdg

Children who grew up in the U.S. under the protection of their parents’ temporary visas do not qualify for the DACA program, and risk losing their legal status when they turn 21. They are urging the Biden administration to act on an immigration overhaul. https://t.co/lD1Pw7rP3B

Tucker Carlson, the host of the most-watched show on prime-time cable news, uses a simple narrative to instill fear in his viewers. To understand how he promotes extremist ideas and conspiracy theories, we analyzed 1,150 episodes. Here’s what we found. https://t.co/qUVe1jpso4

Delta Air Lines diverted a shipment of five million honeybees bound for Alaska to Atlanta and left the bee shipment out on a hot tarmac. Local beekeepers tried to come to the rescue, but very few survived. “This is just such a waste, an absolute tragedy.” https://t.co/Zc3dRi3XkB

A former Idaho state representative was convicted Friday of raping a 19-year-old legislative intern after a dinner in 2021, a case that spurred the Republican lawmaker’s resignation last year and the censure of another lawmaker who had doxxed the victim. https://t.co/TkPR8BdnDr

Naomi Judd, of the Grammy-winning country duo The Judds and the mother of Wynonna and Ashley Judd, died on Saturday. She was 76.
Her death came one day before The Judds were set to be inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame. https://t.co/LNeyDGLhV0 https://t.co/ttkAlHDktj

A man in a lab coat showed up with Russian soldiers at a Ukrainian museum. When they left, priceless gold artifacts were gone, officials said. And it was hardly the first attack on Ukrainian culture since the war began. https://t.co/EL95Xm6u5A https://t.co/UohCoQJ7PQ

A New York Times analysis of 1,150 episodes reveals how Tucker Carlson pushes extremist ideas and conspiracy theories into millions of households. Night after night, he uses a simple narrative: "They" want to control and then destroy "you." https://t.co/9hHa4YNrDn

Besieged by multiplying scandals and salacious accusations, Representative Madison Cawthorn, Republican of North Carolina, is under mounting pressure from both parties to end his short career in Congress. https://t.co/qxLL4Fy7Kv

Tucker Carlson, the host of the most-watched show on prime-time cable news, uses a simple narrative to instill fear in his viewers. To understand how he promotes extremist ideas and conspiracy theories, we analyzed 1,150 episodes. Here’s what we found. https://t.co/erE9z7xSge https://t.co/HEygrwwqbu

A recent series of attacks in Russia have been some of the most opaque developments in the war. If carried out by Ukraine, they represent acts of once nearly unimaginable audacity; one prompted the first air raid siren on Russian soil since World War II. https://t.co/bc0NhgBXpc

Tucker Carlson has constructed what is, by some measures, the most successful show in the history of cable news. It may also be the most racist.
The New York Times examined how he positioned himself to inherit the movement that grew around Donald Trump. https://t.co/jmXH4p0uju https://t.co/lc8RdQpwNb

Coronavirus cases and hospitalizations are rising in a majority of American states, in what appears to be the first widespread increase since the peak of the Omicron surge in January. https://t.co/KfgZFZbybh

“We want to go home,” a girl says in one video. “We want to see the sunshine.”
In the absence of independent media to chronicle their plight, fighters inside a steel plant in Mariupol, Ukraine, are publishing videos to show the world their hardship. https://t.co/pHMUrhVpjw

“If Mariupol is hell, Azovstal is worse.” The mayor of Mariupol, Ukraine, appealed for international help evacuating civilians as conditions deteriorated inside the Azovstal steel complex, the city’s last holdout for Ukrainian fighters and civilians. https://t.co/iYVgfpYOe6 https://t.co/1wWFrTYVTQ

A couple digitized dozens of cassettes they found in their Fire Island home. The tapes, accumulated from 1979 to 1999, captured the soundtrack to a critical juncture in gay history as the AIDS crisis emerged. https://t.co/iNt3Wn4OCn

“We want to go home,” a girl says in one video. “We want to see the sunshine.”
In the absence of independent media to chronicle their plight, fighters inside a steel plant in Mariupol, Ukraine, are publishing videos to show the world their hardship. https://t.co/tKtsv4Fvig

The body of Vira Hyrych, a prominent Ukrainian radio journalist, was recovered after a Russian missile strike on her apartment building in Kyiv. She had worked for Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, a U.S.-funded independent news organization, since 2018. https://t.co/kHqKQiSN3c https://t.co/D7Gariy399
It was only a fish! It was only a fish! https://t.co/CD3dL8tc0Y https://t.co/r2zpIaGTai

Ukraine published the names and photos of 10 Russian soldiers whom they accuse of kidnapping and torturing unarmed civilians in the town of Bucha, the most detailed accusation yet against Russian forces in Ukraine. https://t.co/TBB74V5FsO https://t.co/pBR5ilCpJF
A shipment of five million honeybees was diverted to Atlanta and left out on a hot tarmac. Local beekeepers tried to come to the rescue, but very few survived. https://t.co/KiBIZwvtxC

In Opinion
"One need not find Elon Musk personally or politically appealing to appreciate that his contributions to humanity could end up being profound," Farhad Manjoo writes. https://t.co/uPNdyKsAkz

Airbnb told employees that they would have the option to permanently work remotely, joining a number of companies that have ditched return-to-office plans. U.S. employees can also move to anywhere in the country without a reduction to their compensation. https://t.co/AfF2lgUgI3

Over the past 15 years, many college-educated workers have experienced a gap between their expectations and their job prospects. Now, they’re fighting back by unionizing, raising the possibility of a once-in-a-century revival of the labor movement. https://t.co/VoLhZ45EVG
A study found that for predicting some dog behaviors, breed is essentially useless, and for most, not very good. https://t.co/JYD3pcfOIs https://t.co/sRDNDvjSgT

In a warehouse-turned-bomb-shelter in Lviv, in western Ukraine, a group of children performed a play featuring a range of stories about family separation as told from the perspective of children. https://t.co/wpT7BCTKRN

The FDA announced a plan to ban sales of menthol-flavored cigarettes. Public health experts say the proposal could save hundreds of thousands of lives, especially among Black smokers — 85% of whom use menthol products. https://t.co/tR0bxqPZGK https://t.co/dL33QsHaH6

“There’s definitely a sci-fi element to it,” an engineer who worked on Perseverance’s parachute system said of photographs released on Wednesday. “It exudes otherworldly, doesn’t it?” https://t.co/aT4JuAp8tX https://t.co/dDvNkam63s

“The cost of this fight is not cheap,” President Biden said on Thursday as he called on Congress to approve $33 billion in additional aid for Ukraine, arguing that American weapons and humanitarian assistance are helping to beat back Russian forces. https://t.co/2iY3UkbwyB https://t.co/QBMijABMDt

President Biden asked Congress on Thursday for $33 billion in additional aid for Ukraine, saying “the cost of this fight is not cheap,” but that, “caving to aggression is going to be more costly if we allow it to happen.” https://t.co/xqhUaHPBLb https://t.co/ewvSvrh5dB

Climate change will drive thousands of viruses to jump from one species of mammal to another over the next 50 years, a new study has shown. As the planet warms, bats in Southeast Asia will be especially prone to spreading viruses to other mammals. https://t.co/bTMKUWDbGo

Breaking News: The FDA announced a plan to ban sales of menthol-flavored cigarettes. Public health experts say the proposal could save hundreds of thousands of lives, especially among Black smokers — 85% of whom use menthol products. https://t.co/EQWMC8gTNs

While Elon Musk’s exact plans for Twitter remain unclear, his promises to remove barriers to free speech on the platform have raised alarms among those who fight the toxic and at times dangerous flow of misinformation and disinformation. https://t.co/0aZmi7xJIG
Breaking News: President Biden will propose making it easier for the U.S. to seize assets of Russian oligarchs and use the proceeds to help Ukraine in its war against Russia. https://t.co/Fkgev3TyWo
Ed Balls https://t.co/zPPUNVkXJN

If the plan was to terrify Poland and Bulgaria with the prospect of unheated homes and cold meals to break their will to help Ukraine, Russia chose the wrong season to halt the flow of natural gas. https://t.co/oOYY9IyqeR

"There is no way a war can be acceptable in the 21st century," said António Guterres, the UN secretary general, as he toured wreckage near Kyiv. He called the war in Ukraine "an absurdity." https://t.co/cT0lXRTonN

Prosecutors said Thomas Raynard James had the same name as a suspect, leading to his wrongful conviction for murder in 1991. On Wednesday, a judge approved a motion to vacate James’s conviction and sentence, setting him free after over 31 years in prison. https://t.co/10fGprihfB

The mayor of Mariupol pleaded on Wednesday for European help to rebuild his shattered city and said that 20,000 people had been killed there since Russia’s invasion in February. https://t.co/mUz2UIq1gk https://t.co/0eyMLYdgO8
